attributes.action: ensure that individuals in the UK understand the precise nature of the proposed and current data sharing, and call upon him to make the default value for data sharing to be "Not without my explicit consent" for each individual (or Opt In)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Data is held in the UK on members of its population by many government departments.  Government desires the ability to have full and free transfer between departments of personal data, some of which may be defined as "Sensitive Data" under the Data Protection Act 1998.

We believe that data transfer is inherently fine provided that the individual knows it is taking place and has given permission for it to take place, permission which may be rescinded at any time.

We therefore ask for all such data transfers, current or proposed, to have a default status such that each individual must opt in to that transfer, without which opt in the transfer will not take place.
